title: 3D Viewer Orbital Controls Functionality
description: Verify the 3D facade viewer allows smooth and precise 360° orbital camera controls, including orbit, zoom, and pan functionality without rendering glitches.

steps.description: Load 3D facade model in the viewer.
Perform orbital rotation around the model using mouse drag or touch gestures.
Check the model orbits smoothly without jitter or lag.
Zoom in and out using scroll wheel or pinch gesture.
Zoom happens smoothly, maintaining model resolution and no clipping occurs.
Pan the view horizontally and vertically.
Panning adjusts the viewport fluidly without graphical glitches.

title: Material Picker Real-Time Update
description: Ensure that selecting different facade materials from the dynamic material picker updates the 3D model textures and shaders instantly without requiring a page reload.

steps.description: Select a 3D facade model for customization.
Open the material picker and choose a new facade material.
The 3D model's facade textures update immediately and reflect the selected material with accurate shaders.
Switch to another material and observe update.
Material changes occur without page reload and without artifacts.

title: Eco-Calculator KPI Recalculation on Material Change
description: Validate that the eco-calculator dashboard recalculates and updates all relevant KPIs (Carbon Footprint, Thermal Conductivity, Sustainability Score) instantly when the facade material is changed.

steps.description: Load a facade model with an initial material selection.
Note initial KPIs for carbon footprint, thermal conductivity, and sustainability score.
Change facade material using the material picker.
Verify that the eco-calculator updates KPIs accurately and reflects expected changes compared to reference facades.

title: Tech Specs Viewer Accuracy and Completeness
description: Confirm that the Tech Specs Viewer displays detailed metadata for selected materials including technology summaries, patents, and certifications accurately as per database entries.

steps.description: Select a facade material from the picker.
Open the Tech Specs Viewer panel for the selected material.
Verify the display includes all metadata fields: technology transfer summary, patents, certifications, and other technical details.
Cross-check displayed metadata with the corresponding database entries for accuracy.

title: Secure Asset Storage and Access Control
description: Verify that user assets including 3D models and session data are securely stored with role level security enforced and access URLs expire after a limited time.

steps.description: Upload a 3D model file to the user’s asset storage bucket.
Confirm the model is stored securely and accessible by the authorized user.
Attempt to access the stored asset URL after expiration time.
Confirm that the signed URL is invalid once expired, preventing unauthorized access.
Attempt unauthorized access to storage buckets with different user roles.
Verify access is denied according to role-level security policies.

title: 3D Model File Upload and Rendering
description: Ensure the system accepts valid .obj 3D model files uploaded locally and renders them accurately in the 3D viewer.

steps.description: Navigate to the model upload section.
Upload a valid .obj file representing an architectural facade.
Verify the file upload completes successfully with appropriate user feedback.
Verify the 3D viewer renders the uploaded model correctly with correct geometry and textures.

title: Error Handling on Invalid Model Upload
description: Confirm the system handles invalid or corrupted model file uploads gracefully by showing appropriate error messages without crashing.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a corrupted or unsupported file format (e.g., .txt file) in the model upload section.
System rejects the file with a clear, user-friendly error message.
No crashes or freezes occur and the user can continue using the application normally.

title: User Session Persistence and Retrieval
description: Verify that user session data including selected models, material customizations, and dashboard states are securely saved and properly restored upon user return.

steps.description: Log in and select a facade model and customize materials.
Interact with 3D viewer and eco-dashboard to change settings.
Log out or close the application.
Log back in with the same user account.
Verify that the previous session state including selected model, applied materials, and dashboard settings are restored correctly.

title: Telemetry Logging Accuracy and Completeness
description: Validate telemetry logging captures all required user interactions such as material selections and AR activations, and that data is correctly stored with no loss.

steps.description: Perform a series of user actions: change materials, open tech specs, activate AR module.
Check telemetry logs in Supabase contain corresponding event entries with accurate timestamps and user identifiers.
Simulate interrupted network during actions and retry.
Confirm no telemetry data is lost and all intended events are eventually logged.

title: Eco-Calculator Dashboard Comparative Analysis Display
description: Ensure that the eco-calculator dashboard correctly displays comparative analysis metrics between the selected facade materials and predefined reference facades.

steps.description: Select materials with varying sustainability scores.
Verify the dashboard visualizes KPIs side by side comparing current material against baseline references.
Check comparative visualizations update dynamically as materials change.
